headline: Zucchini Patties
description: These cheesy zucchini patties make a lovely change from potato pancakes during summer squash season. Serve with tomato sauce or sour cream on top.

video.description: Change up your breakfast routine with these zucchini pancakes.
video.name: Zucchini Patties

name: Zucchini Patties

recipeInstructions.text: Combine zucchini, eggs, flour, Parmesan cheese, mozzarella cheese, onion, and salt in a medium bowl. Stir well enough to distribute ingredients evenly.
Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Working in batches, scoop tablespoonfuls of zucchini mixture into hot oil and fry until golden brown, about 2 minutes per side.

review.reviewBody: These are AMAZING. I followed exactly what recipe said and their sooo soo good
Excellent recipe! I used smoked mozzarella because that’s what I had on hand. Delicious
Delicious. Cooked in olive oil. May use green onions and add some garlic next time.

This recipe is in my regular rotation, and it's a good way to get non-zucchini lovers to eat it. It's tasty and easier than it looks. The one slight change I make is to add some salt to the shredded zucchini and let it sit for 15 minutes or so to draw out some of the water from the zucchini, then squeeze out as much moisture as you can before mixing in the egg, flour and cheese. I think that this gives a better texture in the end.

Lessons learned: 1) Didn't have a clue how many zuccs to buy. Told the wife 3 or 4 to be on the safe side. She got 6 (bogo). Turns out ONE good sized zucc will make you a cup of shredded, so I made a double batch. 2) I use decent quality stainless fry pans (Misen) and the recommended heat was way too high for me. I had to go below halfway (hair under medium) to keep them from burning. 3) I tended to try to make the patties too large. Better off with smaller/flatter so they cook through in the time that they brown. 4) I felt like they needed more seasoning so I will experiment next time with some Sunny Paris blend (Penzys) in the mix, probably some pepper, who knows what else. Definitely will make again. Piece of cake if you have a food processor.
Easy to make. Simple ingredients that are usually on hand. Both grown sons loved them too.
Excellent recipe and my wife and I have made it and it was easy to follow.

Absolutely loved this. I took others advice and patted the zucchini to dry. Instead of flour I used Garlic Instant Potatoes. It added that perfect amount of flavor. Happy for another recipee for all are excess zucchini.

I made these for some vegetarian friends and everyone loved them. My only fault was not adding enough salt as I thought that the parmesan cheese would be salty enough on its own. A great dish on it's own or as an appetizer. Thank you Sherlie!
I made these a few days ago with cheese toast and loved them! I would add more mozzarella next time, however! I just like cheesy things.
My fiance asked me to please save this recipe and make it again, we both loved them!! I served them with sour cream and they were delicious!!
I'm trying to adjust the servings to 5 or 7 not sure yet... how many I need to do... but it won't adjust it... I guess I'm gonna just double everything and hope for the best. 🤣🤣
exceptional recipe! taste, consistency, nurtritional value .. will become one of my go-to recipes.

This really should be a five-star recipe because it is so easy. I’m really just annoyed with myself for not thinking about it, but draining the zucchini is an absolute must. There’s just too much water, and that makes the cakes feel not zucchini enough. That should absolutely be in the recipe instructions.
Used almond flour to make it atkins friendly

I made them for the first time tonight for dinner. I used 1 zucchini & 1 yellow squash. I love them. They are delicious!! I will definitely make them again! I would like to try making them in the air fryer. JoAnn
I loved these. Always welcome another great recipe to use up my zucchini. I did double the onion but was the only change. Would love to try some of the other suggestions I saw in reviews.

This was a nice way to use up zucchini. I substituted 2 tbs. Bisquick, 3 tbs. of Italian bread crumbs and 3 tbs. flour for the 1/2 cup flour. I added two cloves of chopped garlic, and seasoned with pepper, and onion powder. Make sure to really drain and squeeze out the moisture from the zucchini. I fried these in a little olive oil, 2 minutes each side to crisp them up, then put them in a 325 oven for 10 more minutes.
Delicious! I made it in the oven, and it was gobbled up in a minute. I just made a second batch only two days later.

I had an abnormally large zucchini and wanted to try and use it all. I planned to make several zucchini breads, but wondered what else I could do with it and came across this recipe. Ratings were great, so why not! I thought they turned out pretty tasty. College kid/twin A loved them, and tried topping them with every thing from sour cream to boom boom sauce to green goddess dressing! Twin B is already back to college and missed out. Not sure why but I had some small packets of instant cheese potato mixes and I substituted them for the flour and thought they were great. Made a few batches!

This was absolutely delicious! Even my son loved it! Changes I made (because I had more than 2 cups of zucchini grated) were: added in an extra 1/2 cup of shredded cheddar/co jack cheese, 2 minced garlic cloves, instead of flour I used Bisquick and added about 1/4 teaspoon of sriracha sauce. Served with sour cream. I can’t wait to eat the leftovers tomorrow! Will reheat in the air fryer to get them crispy again. This is a keeper and have already passed this along to family members. 😊

This was soooo delicious and super easy to make. I didn't have mozz cheese so I used shredded cheddar instead. It was so good. I ate two before I even offered any to my family. I made a spicy ranch dip to go with them. I will be making these again and again. YAY!
It came out good! True to the recipe

This is such a good recipe! I agree with another reviewer that it's hard to fry them fast enough! I make them every chance I get and they are a staple at my house! COOKS NOTE...Be sure to use a grater with BIG holes.. grating too fine will result in mush! 8/16/2022 Update Yes, I'm still making these. It's important to squeeze as much liquid as possible out of the grated zucchini. Instead of mozzarella I used some Mexican blend grated cheese because I wanted to use up the open bag. Deeelish!
I did not make any changes-they were delicious will definitely make these regularly
Made it on a whim because I had too many zucchini. I added shredded carrots that were hanging out in the fridge and it tasted excellent.
The cheese is all wrong. Sorry we did not like the flavor profile.
These were perfect! All I changed was traded mozzarella for cheddar so my 7 year old picky eater would maybe eat them. He did! Super brown, and crispy!
Delicious...I added Mrs Dash and paprika.

This is a good base recipe that you can easily modify to taste and creativity. I started by drain8ng my grated zucchini overnught which gave a great and easy consistency. IWhile frying I sprinkled the salt on top and it was too much so the next batch, no salt and it was great. I also substituted Mexican cheese mix for mozzerella to get some good crispy edges. I plan to make a yogurt/garlic aioli topping with tomatoes for a fun benedict. Next time, mushrooms too!
Delicious! I didn’t use any salt and baked mine in the oven on parchment paper, 400* flipping over halfway through (Can’t recall how long but until brown )
Made just like the recipe said, and they were delicious!
Great recipe. Used the air fryer instead of pan frying. I made one batch with 2 eggs and one batch with 1 egg. Both turned out great... the 1 egg was lighter and less filling.
I substituted whole eggs for liquid egg whites. I also used a non stick pan to cook them, no oil needed. They turned out delicious and a bit healthier. 😊
So good . Thanks for the recipe

Fantastic! The only thing that I did differently was to use Bisquick instead of flour. I forgot the salt, so I salted as they came out of the pan. I thought they were great, then I added a dollop of sour cream on the top. Even better. Will definitely make again!

Wow! These are so good! I did as one other reviewer suggested and substituted instant potato flakes for the flour. Also added a dash of cayenne pepper. Mmmm! Thanks for a great way to use up an abundance of zucchini!

We love this recipe. Fortunately we have a friend with a garden so we get nice organic zucchini for free!! I echo the changes of using either pancake mix or dried potatoes flakes. I have also sprinkled some flavored bread crumbs for flavor. I noticed a lot of you add fresh garlic. I’m going to try that as well. You can’t go wrong with this tasty summer treat. 😋
It was perfect.
It was a great base recipe. I added my own seasoning. Good as is but easy to adapt!
I made it today. We loved it.

Loved!!!! These were so simple. I made them gluten free and vegan using gluten free all purpose flour, vegan egg substitute, and vegan cheese. YUM!!!!! Even my husband who is a meat guy lived these and said repeat.
I've tried zucchini pattie recipes before and found them so so. This one was great. The addition of cheese makes the difference
Really tasty and easy to make! The whole family loved them and kept asking for more!
This is keeper!!! I did make a few adjustments. Added a tsp of baking powder, a clove of garlic, and a green onion. YUM!!!
Turned out great and super easy! I substituted Parmesan for a couple of handfuls of Italian breadcrumbs and instead of salt used some ranch seasoning I had. Love how versatile this recipe is!
Absolutely delicious! Substituted 1/2 the flour with Italian bread crumbs. Topped with a dab of sour cream & a small amount of pizza sauce!
Love this. I make recipe as stated and fry up a double batch and then freeze them for times when I am looking for a quick side to heat up with a meal or leftovers.
This is so tasty and easy to make. It transformed the zucchini into a nice side.

I used 2 small poblano peppers, finely chopped from my garden and shallots instead of regular onion. I also added fresh chopped basil, thyme, and rosemary from my herb garden. I topped each patty (8) with a dollop of fresh pesto. Everyone enjoyed these for a change of pace and one son asked me to keep the recipe. There were no leftovers! I cooked them in olive oil on the stove, but I might try the oven method next time. I will also probably use red onion in the future.
We enjoy making them. We bake them in the oven and they c ok me out sooooo good! They are so good and most of the family eats them! That's actually a bit rare!! We love them.
After shredding Zucchini and onion, be sure to wring out all the water before adding the rest of the ingredients. I make these all the time and they are delightful!
I added a little extra ingredients like carrots, garlic, 2 chile jalapeños. It just elevated the dish. Yummy.
Made exactly as written. It was quite bland. Next time I would add garlic or some peppers of some sort maybe. Texture was nice.
Absolutely delicious! Just remember to use a cheesecloth and squeeze out some of the water, but not all, from the shredded zucchini or the batter will be too thin.

I chopped up shrimp and partially sautéed it in butter before dropping the zucchini mixture on top of each chunk of shrimp. I also added garlic (as did other cooks), and it plus the shrimp made a great meal with a fresh cucumber, grape tomato and mozzarella salad. Delicious!

A great way to enjoy Jersey's fresh zucchini. My new wife had never tasted these before. Now they're a favorite. I make a double batch, they line a hoagie roll top with fresh mozzarella and tomato sauce. A great sandwich.
Perfect for using up over-abundant zucchini from the garden. I included basil, which worked well and tasted great.
I cooked them by the recipe and then air fried them, they were good, might add some fresh spices next time. Airfry 8 minutes flip another 8!
Came out perfect! Tasty. Puffed up to a nice golden outside and tender inside.
I used shredded cheddar jack cheese and doubled the recipe. It is so tasty.
I made this recipe and used a three cheese blend of mozzarella, sharp cheddar, and grated parm. Topped with a slice of tomato and nice dollop of sour cream. Delish!! Great recipe.

I made this according to the directions. I must say that these were delicious. I think I will make a sauce to go with them next time, they deserve it. Simple, Quick and filling. This was a nice light dinner after a long day for my my wife. Thank you

Gerry...I love to cook These were absolutely delicious! I did not have mozzarella so I left it out. I did add chopped garlic and Italian seasoning. I will never again use bread crumbs for my zucchini patties. Just perfect! Thank you

Tried this today and it will be among my favorites! I took a chance doubling the recipe and glad I did since I made mine pancake size. Went with suggested modifications of adding some fresh cut porta Bella mushrooms, crushed garlic, roasted red pepper flakes and I used green onions. Sautéed the garlic and onion before adding to mix. Also used mostly Italian bread crumbs and little flour. And I sprinkled each side with breadcrumbs once I formed the patties. Even though I removed liquid from zucchini, the mix was a little wet so I mixed in more breadcrumbs. Very good!!!
This will not stay in patties
This was ok,
Loved it! My Childcare toddlers not as much but more for me then. Followed recipe as written. Thank you

The whole family loved it!
Only change I made was to add Old Bay Seasoning instead of salt.
Easy & super delicious!!
Next time substitute 1/2 of the flour with buisquick, and chopped garlic. Consistency very good.

This was good. Had 4 cups grated zucchini. Used more Italian bread crumbs in place of flour. Only used 2 eggs. Did add a couple tbsp. Flour. Also added feta cheese as well as garlic. Had quite a few so did them on bbq. On a bbq sheet.

Very good and very easy. However, I don’t think the mozzarella cheese is necessary, it makes it taste a bit too gooey. Gooey in a pancake seems uncooked. Next time I think I’ll try it with just the Parmesan.
These were very good. They tasted like a vegetable crab cake. I added Italian seasoning and garlic. I also used 1/4 cup flour and 1/4 cup unseasoned bread crumbs. I will make again.
These were good but way more batter-y and “pancake”-like than I expected or was looking for.
Easy to make, i did add a bit more flour to absorb the zucchini liquid and a touch of baking powder. I also served it with a garlic/ponzu aioli.
I did not have enough zucchini so I shredded one potato and thru it in. Otherwise followed the recipe and it was great!

Made these on a griddle on my BBQ. Used cheddar cheese instead of mozzarella.
I know its a winner when my wife says"make these again".
Great recipe...and simple.
Really liked these. Added chopped parsley and garlic. Served with sour cream and fresh chives

So good! I made it mostly as is, the only thing I had to substitute was the mozzarella because I didn't have any. I used queso cojita instead, but everything else was per recipe ingredients. The only thing I might try next time, & oh there will be a next time, is using garlic salt w/ parsley instead of plain salt. Just as a variation. LOVE IT!
This was a simple, easy, delicious recipe.

Amazing recipe turned out wonderful I added seasoned Panko crumbs to both sides of the Patty before frying I also shredded the zucchini and sprinkle some salt on it to draw out water then I hand squeezed it. I can’t upload picture but they were beautiful brown crust.
We make em all the time!

Great recipe! I make these all the time. Definitely salt and drain the zucchini after grating. I usually do it in the morning, sometimes the night before. I recently started using only 1 egg which helps keep the patties together better for me. Luv, luv, thx!!
LOVE this recipe! I have made this now several times without any modifications and my entire family devours them, including the kiddos. My daughter actually requested them again this week.
Wonderful will make often but do be careful cooking until both sides are browned they are not very firm, but worth the effort

I did make a few changes based on availability. Used summer squash instead of zucchini, substituted Italian bread crumbs for the flour, didn't have any mozzarella so used some Italian cheese and cheddar. I also added some chopped green chile and then some extra bread crumbs to thicken it a bit. So perhaps 5 stars is not exactly accurate for the recipe as written, but with the changes that I made, it was delicious!
This recipe was fast and easy. it was also a big hit. I made it twice now; the second time I added garlic powder and season salt. even better!!!
These were amazing, I followed the recipe exactly and they turned out to be absolutely delicious. I will definitely be adding these to my regular recipe rotation.

I have made this recipe twice now. It is so good! The only differences were that the second time I was out of mozzarella so I substituted extra sharp cheddar. We actually liked it a bit better that way. Also, rather than fry them I baked them at 375 for 15 minutes, flipped them over and baked for another 10 minutes. Otherwise, I followed the recipe as written. Really, really good!
Delicious!
Awesome flavor. Tastes almost like potato pancakes with maple syrup on it.

I was making beef burger sliders as starters and needed a veg option and I made these patties. Was a big hit. Everyone preferred this to the beef burgers, which is so exceptional in my beef loving group. I baked tiny buns and I kept this between cherry tomatoes, quartered cheese slices with a dash of mayo and ketchup. Mouth watering
This is my go-to recipe when the zucchini plants are producing and I need to use the zucchini!

Great recipe, the whole fam loved it even though it was mainly zucchini (one of my boys has an issue with zucchini). I doubled the recipe but used one less egg (3), I added garlic powder and about a teaspoon of curry then fried in coconut oil. Delish!! Will be making it again for sure.

I made the recipe as is. It worked out well and I didn't have issues with the moisture of the zucchini. I did think they were a little bland, so either more seasonings next time or I will try the Italian bread crumbs instead of flour as others recommended.
Loved it! Only added garlic powder and freshly ground pepper for a little seasoning. Family loved it too! Will make this a staple during summertime.
Good
These were delicious! I made them exactly as written and they were amazing. I had some left over for breakfast and served a fried egg on top and they were a big hit! Will definitely make again!

My meal plan calls for a veggie burger monthly. I haven't found any that I like until I tried this recipe. They freeze up nicely. Only drawback is they don't hold together as well as I'd like, but they taste yummy.
